text:
We have a 40 year history
of telling the weather,
and we're one of the most trusted brands
and the most accurate weather forecaster.

Generative AI allows
us to hit different parts

of the market segments with
more accurate information
that's just in time for their use case.
Weather forecast is useless

unless it reaches the person
it's supposed to reach.

We take more than a
hundred different forecasts
and we window those down

to make the most accurate
forecast for the application.

Generative AI allows us to
describe a forecast,
a context and inputs in a way
that's hyper-personalized to the audience.
When a customer goes to weather.com,
that experiences delivered on AWS

and with 26 billion
forecasts daily,
there's a lot of traffic.
The weather changes constantly

and the weather change
creates a lot of data.

When you move data to a place,
you need to deliver all

of your insights and all of
your value from that place.

Building a solid data
foundation on AWS lets us get
ancillary use cases from that data.
An example is in the enterprise
space, the weather engine,
which is one of our enterprise offerings,

lets businesses subscribe
to custom AI models
that give them insights about the weather.
When we first started,

we had a very clumsy
container based workflow,

which was very difficult
to scale and manage.

We worked with a generative
AI innovation center

to establish ML Ops, which
led our business be more agile

and efficient with its
development of ML and AI models.

ML Ops is basically a pipeline
based delivery,

using SageMaker and
other AWS technologies
to provide models and inference

and training, all in a way that
lets us focus on data science

and weather forecasting as
opposed to computer science.
We save 90% reduction in our costs

and overhead with a 20%
increase in model creation
because of this adoption of ML Ops.
By using AWS, we're guaranteed
regional parity, AZs within those regions,
and then a number of different services
that all are compliant with standards
and protocols of the AWS foundation.
AWS lets us scale to planet size scale
for a planet size problem.
The weather is getting more chaotic,

and as it gets more chaotic,
it produces more data.
There's more impact on human

and civilization, so getting
the most accurate forecast

specifically to the
customer that's desiring it

or around their business
needs is important to us.
